definition: meddling in other people's business
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
variant of 管[guan3]
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: ShenXing smell speech flew into a rage and scolded Amy assume find out other peoples privacy.
sentences.chinese: 沈星闻言勃然大怒，训斥艾米多管闲事打探他人隐私。

sentences.english: Well, I know what time Chester and Marsha said.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想多管闲事，不过告诉我你跟马莎怎么了。

sentences.english: But that lock didn't just keep busybodies at bay.
sentences.chinese: 但这个锁并不只是为了阻止多管闲事的人靠近。

sentences.english: I don't mean to be nosy, but tell me what happened between you and Marsha .
sentences.chinese: 我并不想多管闲事，不过告诉我你跟马莎怎么了。

sentences.english: But that lock didn’t just keep busybodies at bay.
sentences.chinese: 但这个锁并不只是为了阻止多管闲事的人靠近。

sentences.english: You are rather disposed to call his interference officious?
sentences.chinese: 你认为他的干涉完全是多管闲事吗？
